conclusion: To find the magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B, use the principle of equilibrium in the current balance.
When the current I passes through the coil, the magnetic force on the coil is F = nBIL.
The system is in equilibrium, so the magnetic force is balanced by the gravitational force of the weights on the right arm.
When the current is reversed, the direction of the magnetic force also reverses.
To balance the system again, an additional weight of mass m is added to the left pan.
The new magnetic force is F' = nBIL (same magnitude but opposite direction).
The gravitational force due to the additional weight is mg.
In the new equilibrium, the magnetic force and the gravitational force of the additional weight balance each other: nBIL = mg.
Rearrange the equation to solve for B: B = mg/nIL.
The magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B is given by B = mg/nIL.
